intro: Tetrapogon brandegeei, commonly known as the Brandegee's tetrapogon, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sedges. The plant is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Tetrapogon brandegeei is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
